English: Tunis is the latest anti-radar technology that can detect 3 cm radars. Allies haven't yet developed their radar technology that far, but Tunis also has the best range among all radar detectors and also can indicate the direction of incoming signal.
Borkum is a radar detector that can detect Allied centimetric radars that are invisible to Metox, yet it has a limited range and cannot indicate the direction of incoming signal.
Naxos I is a reliable device that can detect Allied centimetric radars with a bit better range than Borkum and ability to indicate the direction of incoming signal.
Metox is a device consisting of a rudimentary wooden antenna, yet very effective. It's tuned to pick up British ASV radar and alert the crew of incoming danger.
Basic antenna used for long range communication and direction finding.
Potassium permanganate in the absorbers reacts with carbon dioxide and effectively clears it from air extending the time of its usefulness for breathing.
A common food ration. Put it in the kitchen to use it for cooking.
A luxury food ration. Put it in the kitchen to use it for cooking.
A medkit for wounded or sick people. It's best used by an officer with proper medical training.
HE ammunition causing standard damage to ship’s hulls and crew, having a large damage radius and increased ability to cause a fire.
HE ammunition causing standard damage to ship’s hulls and crew, having a large damage radius and increased ability to cause a fire.
AP ammunition causing high damage to hulls.
AP ammunition causing high damage to hulls.
AA ammo is set to detonate after a specified period of time, thus increasing the chances of including a plane in its damage radius.
AA ammo is set to detonate after a specified period of time, thus increasing the chances of including a plane in its damage radius.
Flares designed to be fired from large caliber guns.
Flares designed to be fired from small caliber guns.
The engineers need these to repair broken equipment and water leaks on board.
It's required to dive to a wreck.
It allows a sailor to stay and work in compartments underwater or with toxic air. It's equipped automatically when needed, but it wears out in time.
Protects from some damage that would normally be inflicted to the officer, but wears out in that process.
Prototype of the experimental radar that we need to obtain for headquarters.
A standard food ration. Place it in the galley so the cook can use it to make dishes.
A standard food ration. Place it in the galley so the cook can use it to make dishes.
A standard food ration. Place it in the galley so the cook can use it to make dishes.

Engineers can salvage spare parts from it at a ratio of 2:1.
Drinking coffee recovers officer's energy by about 20%.
Small arms may be useful for officers going on dangerous missions outside.
This decoy can be ejected through the "pills launcher" in the stern torpedo room to create a false target for enemy sonars.

Iron Cross decoration was established in 1813 by King Friedrich Wilhelm III of Prussia. It has a long tradition in German military. It's awarded for a single act of bravery in the battle. The black core is made of solid iron and the frame is made of alloy called German silver.
Iron Cross 1st Class is awarded for repeated acts of bravery in the battle. It's a higher tier of Iron Cross decoration and comes with a pin at the back instead of a ribbon.

German Cross in Gold is a newly established decoration awarded for repeated acts of bravery in combat. It's ranked higher than Iron Cross and paves the way to reputable Knight's Cross decoration. Crews commonly call this decoration a "fried egg" due to the shape it has.

Knight's Cross is a very respectable decoration granted for exceptional acts of bravery. It's the highest type of decoration in German military. Core of this award is made of iron and the frame is 800 grade silver.

Key: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves Description
English: Oak Leaves on the Knight's Cross decoration were awarded to only the best skippers with exceptional skills. It's a very respectable decoration.

Key: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves and Crossed Swords
English: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves and Crossed Swords

Key: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves and Crossed Swords Description
English: Crossed Swords on the Knight's Cross are the next addition to the Knight's Cross meant for recipients of Oak Leaves. It's a very respectable decoration and only a few Kriegsmarine officers received it.

Key: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves, Crossed Swords and Diamonds
English: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves, Crossed Swords and Diamonds

Key: Knight's Cross with Oak Leaves, Crossed Swords and Diamonds Description
English: Diamonds are the last addition to the Knight's Cross. Very few Kriegsmarine officers received such high award.

Key: Knight's Cross with Golden Oak Leaves, Swords, and Diamonds
English: Knight's Cross with Golden Oak Leaves, Swords, and Diamonds

Key: Knight's Cross with Golden Oak Leaves, Swords, and Diamonds Description
English: This is the highest grade of Knight's Cross decoration in the German military received only by a single other recipient from Luftwaffe. It's the highest honor to be a recipient of such decoration.
U-boat War Badge is awarded to crew members that participated in 2 war patrols. It was originally instituted during World War I.

Key: U-boat War Badge with Diamonds Description
English: This decoration is awarded to crew members that participated in 8 war patrols. This decoration was instituted from the personal initiative of admiral D?nitz.

Key: U-boat Front Clasp in Bronze Description
English: It's an exclusive decoration for U-boat force members that recognizes continued valor in combat. It's awarded to crew members that participated in 15 war patrols.

Key: U-boat Front Clasp in Silver Description
English: It's an exclusive decoration for U-boat force members that recognizes continued valor in combat. It's awarded to crew members that participated in 25 war patrols.

Key: U-boat Front Clasp in Gold Description
English: It's an exclusive decoration for U-boat force members that recognizes continued valor in combat. It's awarded to crew members that participated in 40 war patrols.
It's a token of appreciation for those wounded at least twice in action.
It's a token of appreciation for those wounded at least four times in action.
It's a token of appreciation for those wounded at least six times in action.
A standard food ration. Place it in the galley so the cook can use it to make dishes.

A standard issue, steam-powered Kriegsmarine torpedo with Pi1 pistol. We are aware of some issues with this pistol design:
- Torpedoes on the impact (AZ) setting must hit the target at an angle close to 90 degrees to explode.
- Launched torpedoes on magnetic (MZ) setting may explode on their own before they reach the target.

A standard issue, steam-powered Kriegsmarine torpedo with a revised version of Pi1 pistol.
- The revised version of the pistol has a reliable impact (AZ) setting that works well at impact angles below 60 degrees, although it may occasionally trigger even at angle reaching 84 degrees.
- Launched torpedoes on magnetic (MZ) setting may explode on their own before they reach the target.
A standard issue, steam-powered Kriegsmarine torpedo with a very reliable pistol design - Pi3.

Key: G7a Torpedo T1 - Pi3 - FAT Description
English:
A standard issue, steam-powered Kriegsmarine torpedo with a very reliable pistol design - Pi3.

This torpedo has a control mechanism for the FAT program. In case of a miss, this torpedo will follow a special pattern that increases the chance of scoring a random hit when fired inside a convoy.

Key: G7a Torpedo T1 - Pi3 - LUT Description
English:
A standard issue, steam-powered Kriegsmarine torpedo with a very reliable pistol design - Pi3.

This torpedo has a control mechanism for the LUT program. In case of a miss, this torpedo will follow a special pattern that increases the chance of scoring a random hit when fired inside a convoy.

A standard issue, electric Kriegsmarine torpedo with Pi1 pistol. We are aware of some issues with this pistol design:
- Torpedoes on the impact (AZ) setting must hit the target at an angle close to 90 degrees to explode.
- Launched torpedoes on magnetic (MZ) setting may explode on their own before they reach the target.

A standard issue, electric Kriegsmarine torpedo with a revised version of Pi1 pistol.
- The revised version of the pistol has a reliable impact (AZ) setting that works well at impact angles below 60 degrees, although it may occasionally trigger even at angle reaching 84 degrees.
- Launched torpedoes on magnetic (MZ) setting may explode on their own before they reach the target.
T3 torpedo design has increased range over its T2 predecessors and uses a new Pi2 pistol design that is considered to be very reliable among u-boat skippers.

Key: G7e Torpedo T3 - Pi2 - Prototype Description
English: T3 torpedo design has increased range over its T2 predecessors and uses a new Pi2 pistol design that is considered to be very reliable among u-boat skippers.

Key: G7es Zaunk?nig Torpedo T5 - Pi4 Description
English: T5 torpedoes use a novel technology of homing on the nearby propeller sounds and also use a very reliable pistol design. The homing mechanism is most sensitive to the propeller sounds emitted by the merchant ships.

Key: G7es Zaunk?nig Torpedo T5 - Pi4 - Prototype

- Launched torpedoes on magnetic (MZ) setting may explode on their own before they reach the target.

Rocks and minerals from which metallic iron can be extracted. Basic raw material in iron metallurgy.
Hard coal is widely used mainly in energy and industry, but also as a fuel.
Wood that has been processed into beams and planks. Lumber is mainly used for structural purposes, but has many other uses as well.
Finest tea leaves from China that are used to make a hot infusion.
Seeds useful in the production of many types of food mainly in bakery. Also used as fodder for livestock.
Natural rubber is essential raw material used in the creation of many products, e.g. gas masks, life rafts, military wiring. It is intermediate for obtaining rubber by vulcanization.
A portable electromechanical encryption machine based on a mechanism of rotating rotors.
